channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How Trump Can Convert A Key Identity Politics Agency Into A Tool For Equality Under The Law
item.description: Americans’ most basic civil rights have never been more in need of robust legal protection.

item.title: A Guide for Investment Analysts: Working with Historical Market Data
item.description: Interested in working with older historical data? Pitfalls lurk for the unwary.

item.title: Exclusive: Oishii, vertical farming startup, closes its Series B at $150 million
item.description: Vertical farming startup Oishii has closed its Series B at $150 million, Fortune can exclusively report.

item.title: California voters reject measure that would have raised minimum wage to nation-high $18 per hour
item.description: Voters in California have rejected a ballot measure that would have raised the state minimum wage to $18 per hour by 2026, the highest in the country.

item.title: Top 10 states where Trump outperformed in 2024
item.description: President-elect Trump flipped six key swing states in his historic win this month, but his gains were nationwide, and some of his biggest were in area...

item.title: Trump picks Linda McMahon for education secretary
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump announced Tuesday that he had selected his transition co-chair Linda McMahon to serve as education secretary.

item.title: Conservatives Would Be Smart To Push Ballot Measures In Blue States
item.description: The best defense is often a good offense, and conservatives have plenty of good issues on which they can run successful ballot campaigns.

item.title: UN Redefines ‘Peace’ To Revolutionize Classrooms With More Critical Theory
item.description: A UN’s agency redefinition of what’s considered “peace” or “violence” is designed to push its harmful education agenda.

item.title: Unsanction Israel
item.description: Biden’s anti-Israel sanctions regime violates several standards of sanctions policy and threatens speech rights of Americans and in other democracies.

item.title: The new academy companies
item.description: In an era where talent is scarce and continuous learning is key, academy companies deserve a second look.

item.title: There’s No Such Thing as ‘Having It All’
item.description: A new report suggests major corporations view maximum flexibility as the most pro-woman benefits policy.

item.title: The West Should Not Fall for Putin’s ‘Red Lines’

item.description: What's next for Republican Gov. Glenn Youngkin of Virginia, who says that former President Trump's decisive election victory earlier this month means ...

item.title: Hacker obtains House ethics testimony on Matt Gaetz as Trump makes calls for AG nominee
item.description: An unidentified hacker has reportedly obtained a file that contains confidential testimony involving allegations of sexual misconduct by Matt Gaetz.

item.title: Americans Sick Of Meds That Don’t Restore Health Love The Idea Of RFK Leading HHS
item.description: It baffles me that people find America's abysmal health statistics less shocking than the appointment of RFK Jr.

item.title: Comcast to spin off NBCU cable TV channels
item.description: The new $7 billion company would reportedly include MSNBC, CNBC, Oxygen, E!, USA Network, Syfy, and Golf Channel.

item.title: Elon Musk wants to meet Alex Soros to ‘understand his goals’ after comparing his billionaire dad George to an X-Men villain
item.description: Alex Soros replied: "I often learn most from people whose views are different than my own. Open to meeting."

item.title: Six Action Items Trump And A GOP Congress Should Pass To Secure Our Elections
item.description: Despite Trump's victory, there are still gaps in election law ripe for abuse by bad actors seeking to disrupt the electoral process.

item.title: The Senate Should Assert Its Power to Block Bad Nominees
item.description: Trump’s nascent battle to undermine the power of the Senate is ultimately being waged in behalf of a false premise.

item.title: Low Probability of Loss: Why It Doesn’t Equal Low Risk in Investing

item.title: Book Review: The M&A Failure Trap
item.description: Massive M&A deals make headlines but too rarely make money for stockholders.

item.title: The CEO of Glassdoor says doubling down on remote work has turbocharged its ability to ‘tap into talent’
item.description: Christian Sutherland-Wong talks anonymous reviews, the current labor market and your future AI job application concierge.
